intro: Palicourea erythrocephala, commonly known as red-headed palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in tropical regions of Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its striking red flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a glossy appearance, while the stems are often woody and branched. Palicourea erythrocephala is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant floral display and adaptability to various growing conditions.
